items.text: I am always eager to start new projects.
items.rationale: Eagerness to start new projects indicates a strong drive towards goals.

items.text: She often takes the initiative in group settings.
items.rationale: Taking initiative is a clear sign of approach-oriented behavior.

items.text: I feel energized when I think about achieving my goals.
items.rationale: Feeling energized by goals is a hallmark of approach motivation.

items.text: He is always looking for new challenges to tackle.
items.rationale: Seeking challenges is indicative of a strong approach motivation.

items.text: I am driven by the excitement of new opportunities.
items.rationale: Excitement for new opportunities reflects approach motivation.

items.text: She thrives in competitive environments.
items.rationale: Thriving in competition suggests a strong approach orientation.

items.text: I often set ambitious goals for myself.
items.rationale: Setting ambitious goals is a clear indicator of approach motivation.

items.text: He is motivated by the possibility of success.
items.rationale: Motivation by success is a key aspect of approach motivation.

items.text: I enjoy taking risks if there's a potential reward.
items.rationale: Risk-taking for rewards is characteristic of approach motivation.

items.text: She is always on the lookout for new experiences.
items.rationale: Seeking new experiences is a sign of approach motivation.

items.text: I am quick to act on new ideas.
items.rationale: Acting quickly on ideas shows a proactive, approach-oriented mindset.

items.text: He is driven by a desire to achieve more.
items.rationale: A desire to achieve more is a core aspect of approach motivation.

items.text: I sometimes hesitate before starting something new.
items.rationale: Hesitation can occur even in approach-oriented individuals, but it introduces some ambiguity.

items.text: She likes to plan her steps before taking action.
items.rationale: Planning can be part of approach motivation but also relates to conscientiousness.

items.text: I am motivated by both the fear of failure and the hope of success.
items.rationale: This statement could reflect both approach (hope of success) and avoidance (fear of failure) motivations.

items.text: I often avoid situations where I might fail.
items.rationale: Avoiding potential failure is a clear indicator of avoidance motivation.

items.text: He tends to shy away from taking risks.
items.rationale: Avoiding risks is a hallmark of avoidance motivation.

items.text: I feel anxious about making mistakes.
items.rationale: Anxiety about mistakes is a key feature of avoidance motivation.

items.text: She often worries about the consequences of her actions.
items.rationale: Worrying about consequences is indicative of avoidance motivation.

items.text: I prefer to stick to what I know rather than try new things.
items.rationale: Preference for familiarity over novelty is a sign of avoidance motivation.

items.text: He is cautious in unfamiliar situations.
items.rationale: Caution in new situations reflects avoidance motivation.

items.text: I often think about what could go wrong.
items.rationale: Focusing on potential negatives is characteristic of avoidance motivation.

items.text: She tends to focus on avoiding negative outcomes.
items.rationale: Focusing on avoiding negatives is a core aspect of avoidance motivation.

items.text: I am driven by a need to prevent failure.
items.rationale: A drive to prevent failure is a clear indicator of avoidance motivation.

items.text: He often feels stressed about potential setbacks.
items.rationale: Stress about setbacks is indicative of avoidance motivation.

items.text: I am more focused on what I don't want to happen.
items.rationale: Focusing on undesired outcomes is a sign of avoidance motivation.

items.text: She is careful to avoid making errors.
items.rationale: Carefulness to avoid errors reflects avoidance motivation.

items.text: I sometimes feel torn between trying something new and sticking to the safe path.
items.rationale: This reflects a conflict between approach and avoidance motivations, introducing ambiguity.

items.text: He likes to weigh all the risks before making a decision.
items.rationale: Risk assessment can be part of avoidance motivation but also relates to conscientiousness.

items.text: I am motivated by the fear of missing out on opportunities.
items.rationale: Fear of missing out could reflect avoidance (fear) or approach (desire for opportunities) motivations.
